channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Joan Didion leaves one more piece of writing to faithful fans
item.description: Didion's book is an intimate chronicle of the author's struggle to help her daughter, even if it meant digging into her own long-unexamined neuroses.

item.title: After Pope Francis' death, debates begin over his successor
item.description: In the weeks that follow the passing of a pontiff, the city of Rome, and the Vatican in particular, comes alive with discussions over which man is bes...

item.title: White House looking to replace Pete Hegseth as defense secretary, official tells NPR
item.description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth shared sensitive military information last month in two Signal group chats. Now, a U.S. official tells NPR a search is ...

item.title: Trump wants a Golden Dome over America. Here's what it would take
item.description: Experts are divided whether a new missile defense system for the U.S., inspired by Israel's Iron Dome, would be worth the cost.

item.title: White House looks for new defense secretary. And, remembering Pope Francis' legacy
item.description: The White House is searching for a new defense secretary to replace Pete Hegseth after a second Signal group chat controversy. And, Pope Francis' lega...

item.title: Putin suggests Russia open to direct talks with Ukraine, as strikes continue
item.description: Moscow launched strikes across Ukrainian cities hours after Putin said he was considering a pause on civilian targets.

item.title: Watch Live: Karen Read's second trial starts with opening statements
item.description: Watch live as Karen Read's second trial starts today with opening statements in the Massachusetts murder case.

item.title: Mar 18: CBS News 24/7, 10am ET
item.description: Israel launches deadly new strikes over Gaza; Astronauts head back to Earth after nine months in space.

item.title: Some GOP states are targeting driverâ€™s licenses issued to immigrants illegally in the US
Anti-Defamation League says anger at Israel is now the driving force behind antisemitism in the US
item.description: The Anti-Defamation League says the number of antisemitic incidents in the United States reached a record high last year.

item.title: Vance calls for stronger India-US relations as trade talks progress
item.description: US Vice-President JD Vance is currently on a four-day visit to India with his wife and three children.

item.title: Who will be the next Pope? Key candidates in an unpredictable contest
item.description: Several names are in the fray as cardinals prepare to gather in the Vatican to elect Pope Francis' successor.

item.title: At least five killed after gunmen open fire on tourists in Indian-administered Kashmir
item.description: The region's chief minister said the attack was "much larger than anything we've seen directed at civilians in recent years".

item.title: Many tourists reportedly killed in attack in Indian-controlled Kashmir
item.description: India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi says the gunmen behind a terrorist attack on tourists in the Kashmir region "will not be spared!"

item.title: 4/22: CBS Morning News
item.description: Pope Francis' funeral is scheduled for Saturday at St. Peter's Basilica, the Vatican announced; President Trump stands by Defense Secretary Pete Hegse...

item.title: IMF forecasts slower growth for U.S. economy in 2025, citing trade war
item.description: The U.S. economy will grow 1.8% this year, the IMF said in its World Economic Outlook, down .9% from January

item.title: New Israel-Gaza ceasefire plan proposed, Hamas source tells BBC
item.description: Egyptian and Qatari mediators suggest a truce of up to seven years and a permanent end to the war.

item.title: Drones pose increasing risk to airliners near major US airports
